description:
Real-world JIT compilers like PyPy and Numba are complex and advanced.
However, the basic ideas behind JIT compilers are easy to understand, as
this talk aim to show.

This will be a live-coding exercise: we will write a working (albeit
simple and limited) JIT compiler from scratch.

**Feedback form:** https://python.it/feedback-1675

in \_\_on **Saturday 4 May** at 12:15 `**See
schedule** </en/sprints/schedule/pycon10/>`__
title: How to write a JIT compiler in 30 minutes
